intro: Eriogonum deductum, commonly known as the San Diego mountain buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to California. It is characterized by its clustered, small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has basal and upright stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal sage scrub and chaparral habitats. Eriogonum deductum plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is considered a rare and endangered species.
